title: league client keeps hanging in champ select
body: I am having a reoccurring problem during champ select.   The counter for one of the players counts to 0 and nothing further happens.   It stays this way for a few minutes then kicks me out.   It counts it as a dodge even through I have no way to correct the problem.  Has lost me my series twice in a row.   Anyone have a solution?

replies.body: Still happening.   Chat client works through the whole time.  It is just the client that does not show when it is my turn to select.

Happened again.   This time I was still chatting with teammates while the counter was stuck at zero.   It does not look like a network issue because I would not have been able to get a receive packets if I was disconnected.   At this rate the account is going to be banned for repeated dodges.  Every third lobby is beyond annoying.

Still happening.   
1) The status of the servers is good.   
2) My connection is wired.
3) Firewall is disabled.
4) I switched dhs servers.
5) I have no packet loss.  I did not lose a single ping packet to multiple sites.  Rock solid time so I have no local traffic interfering.
6) There is no sign of packet buffering problems.
7) Ports are all set properly.
8) I am not running VPN.
9) I renewed lease and flushed the dns server.

I don't believe it is a problem with my connection locally.   The client just stops working randomly.   I just was kicked from champ select because the lock champs button could not be pressed.  The timer was running but the lock button never lit up.  It does display like a lack of connection in that the chat room locks out and occasionally everyone leaves, but if it is network it is up stream of my ISP connection.   I have no problems in game, so I am rather stumped unless the champ select and the game packets are taking a different route.  It has happened 8 times already, and cost me several series as it is forcing dodges at the worst possible time.

When the client hangs in champ select, it's typically an indication that the client is experiencing a brief disconnect from the matchmaking service, and cannot reestablish a stable link. The most common cause of this is any number of local network configurations that don't specifically play well with League. I recommend working through the steps in our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step.

Let me know if you still have issues after working through those steps.

My age is 44 and I am a computer programmer by trade.   And for reference I checked the network connections, reinstalled the client and all the rest.   I don't see any posts that matched the same counter tick down problem.
Quick question, what is your age?
